messages.content: ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale is a set of nodes for ComfyUI that wrap the Ultimate Stable Diffusion Upscale script by Coyote-A, allowing its use within the ComfyUI interface.
To install ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale, navigate to the ComfyUI/custom_nodes/ directory in the command line and run the command: git clone https://github.com/ssitu/ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale --recursive
What are the available nodes in ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale?

ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale provides three nodes: Ultimate SD Upscale (primary node), Ultimate SD Upscale (No Upscale) for already upscaled images, and Ultimate SD Upscale (Custom Sample) with additional inputs for custom sampler and sigmas.
Where can I find detailed parameter descriptions for ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale?

Most of the parameter descriptions for ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale can be found in the FAQ section of the original repository: https://github.com/Coyote-A/ultimate-upscale-for-automatic1111/wiki/FAQ#parameters-descriptions
What does the 'upscale_by' parameter do in ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale?
The 'upscale_by' parameter in ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale is used to multiply the width and height of the image by a specified number for upscaling.
What is the purpose of the 'force_uniform_tiles' parameter in ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale?

When enabled, the 'force_uniform_tiles' parameter in ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale ensures that tiles cut off by the edges of the image are expanded using the rest of the image, maintaining the same tile size determined by 'tile_width' and 'tile_height', similar to the A1111 Web UI behavior.
Can you provide an example of using ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale with the ControlNet tile model?

Yes, an example of using ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale with the ControlNet tile model can be found in the repository's README file, illustrated with an image: https://github.com/ssitu/ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale/assets/57548627/64f8d3b2-10ae-45ee-9f8a-40b798a51655
